POSTGRADUATE STUDIES

There are many reasons for undertaking postgraduate study, career development being the most frequent. However, for many students postgraduate study offers the valuable opportunity to further develop an individual point of view and a clear sense of purpose in their work and in their lives. For many research students, the common interest is in generating new knowledge.

The School of Design is currently developing new masters programme which will be introduced (subject to validation) in Session 2005/06.

Postgraduate students at the GSA benefit from the same facilities and services available to our undergraduate population and in some areas, such as the library, these are enhanced. Within the specialist postgraduate departments and research centres, students have access to specific facilities such as dedicated IT infrastructures and exhibition spaces.

All postgraduate students, with the exception of those studying at the Digital Design Studio, are based in our campus in the centre of the City. Glasgow offers postgraduate students a unique learning and living environment as one of the UK's leading centres for the creative industries and home to the largest creative community outside of London. The School is very much part of this creative community and is active at all levels, both locally and nationally, in its continual development.
